BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Until Monday the weather will be exceptionally warm.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be reduced. The avalanche danger will increase quickly in the early morning. Backcountry tours should be started and concluded very early. As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses. This applies in particular on very steep slopes below approximately 3500 m, as well as at the base of rock walls. Occasionally large natural avalanches are not ruled out. On wind-loaded slopes the avalanches can penetrate even deep layers. In the typical avalanche paths here the avalanches can in some cases reach low altitudes.

The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence at high altitude. These places are clearly recognisable to the trained eye. Backcountry tourers or freeriders can release avalanches. In particular on shady slopes the avalanches can penetrate even deep layers.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
5 to 10 cm of snow fell on Wednesday. The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust only at high altitudes. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to rapid moistening of the snowpack.
The upper section of the snowpack is unfavourably layered.

Several medium-sized dry and wet avalanches have been released in the last two days.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment:
On Sunday it will be very warm.
The surface of the snowpack will already be soft in the early morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be reduced. The avalanche danger will increase quickly in the early morning. Backcountry tours should be started and concluded very early. As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses. This applies in particular on very steep slopes below approximately 3500 m, as well as at the base of rock walls. Occasionally large natural avalanches are not ruled out. On wind-loaded slopes the avalanches can penetrate even deep layers. In the typical avalanche paths here the avalanches can in some cases reach low altitudes.

The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence at high altitude. These places are clearly recognisable to the trained eye. Backcountry tourers or freeriders can release avalanches. In particular on shady slopes the avalanches can penetrate even deep layers.

5 to 10 cm of snow fell on Wednesday. The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust only at high altitudes. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to rapid moistening of the snowpack.
The upper section of the snowpack is unfavourably layered.

Several medium-sized dry and wet avalanches have been released in the last two days.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment:
On Sunday it will be very warm.
The surface of the snowpack will already be soft in the early morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Significant increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses. This applies in particular on very steep slopes below approximately 3000 m, as well as at the base of rock walls.
In particular on very steep sunny slopes moist avalanches can penetrate even deep layers and reach very large size in isolated cases. In very isolated cases, the wet avalanches can reach low altitudes from starting zones where no previous releases have taken place.
The avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found especially on very steep slopes above approximately 2400 m. These places are clearly recognisable to the trained eye.
Backcountry tours and off-piste skiing should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Continuous warming to high altitudes. These spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing settling of the snowpack over a wide area in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow.
The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will soften earlier than the day before. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area below approximately 3000 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be very warm. The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will soften earlier than the day before.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Significant increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses. This applies in particular on very steep slopes below approximately 3000 m, as well as at the base of rock walls.
In particular on very steep sunny slopes moist avalanches can penetrate even deep layers and reach very large size in isolated cases. In very isolated cases, the wet avalanches can reach low altitudes from starting zones where no previous releases have taken place.
The avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found especially on very steep slopes above approximately 2400 m. These places are clearly recognisable to the trained eye.
Backcountry tours and off-piste skiing should be started and concluded very early.

BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be very warm. The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already soften in the late morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Significant increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses. This applies in particular on very steep slopes below approximately 3000 m, as well as at the base of rock walls.
In particular on very steep sunny slopes moist avalanches can penetrate even deep layers and reach very large size in isolated cases. In very isolated cases, the wet avalanches can reach low altitudes from starting zones where no previous releases have taken place.
Backcountry tours and off-piste skiing should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will soften earlier than the day before. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area below approximately 3000 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be very warm. The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already soften in the late morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the natural avalanche activity will rapidly increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: In particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain large wind slabs formed. Most and wet avalanches can over a wide area be released, even by a single winter sport participant and reach large size. Below approximately 2300 m medium-sized to large ground avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area above approximately 1800 m. As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses, even large ones.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Significant warming: The danger of wet avalanches will already increase in the late morning.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the natural activity of wet avalanches will rapidly increase. This applies on steep east and west facing slopes below approximately 2800 m, as well as on steep south facing slopes in all altitude zones, this also applies on shady slopes below approximately 2400 m. The wet avalanches can release the saturated snowpack and reach large size in some cases. In steep gullies avalanches can in some cases reach areas without any snow cover. The danger of natural wet avalanches is within the upper range of danger level 3 (considerable).

On steep grassy slopes more frequent medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

Backcountry tours and ascents to alpine cabins should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather will be exceptionally warm. The surface of the snowpack is hardly frozen at all and will already soften in the late morning. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to extreme and thorough wetting of the snowpack. These conditions will cause a rapid weakening of the snowpack. In areas with a thinner snowpack the saturation and consequently the loss of strength happens more rapidly
Hardly any snow is lying at low and intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be exceptionally warm. The summery weather conditions will give rise to increasing and thorough wetting of the snowpack at elevated altitudes. The danger of wet and gliding avalanches will persist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Significant warming: The danger of wet avalanches will already increase in the late morning.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the natural activity of wet avalanches will rapidly increase. This applies on steep east and west facing slopes below approximately 2800 m, as well as on steep south facing slopes in all altitude zones, this also applies on shady slopes below approximately 2400 m. The wet avalanches can release the saturated snowpack and reach large size in some cases. In steep gullies avalanches can in some cases reach areas without any snow cover. The danger of natural wet avalanches is within the upper range of danger level 3 (considerable).

On steep grassy slopes more frequent medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

Backcountry tours and ascents to alpine cabins should be started and concluded very early.

Backcountry tours and off-piste skiing should be started and concluded very early.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Significant increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses.
In particular on very steep sunny slopes moist avalanches can penetrate even deep layers and reach large size.
Backcountry tours and off-piste skiing should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will soften earlier than the day before. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area below approximately 3000 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be very warm. The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already soften in the late morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase. The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In all regions large and, in isolated cases, very large avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming. Gliding avalanches can also occur. The wind slabs remain for the foreseeable future prone to triggering. The avalanche prone locations are to be found at the base of rock walls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
Avalanches can be released, even by a single winter sport participant. Backcountry touring calls for great caution and restraint.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise to thorough wetting of the snowpack over a wide area. The snowpack will become gradually wet all the way through.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment:
Over a wide area further warming.
As a consequence of warming the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase. The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In all regions large and, in isolated cases, very large avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming. Gliding avalanches can also occur. The wind slabs remain for the foreseeable future prone to triggering. The avalanche prone locations are to be found at the base of rock walls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
Avalanches can be released, even by a single winter sport participant. Backcountry touring calls for great caution and restraint.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise to thorough wetting of the snowpack over a wide area. The snowpack will become gradually wet all the way through.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment:
Over a wide area further warming.
As a consequence of warming the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wet and gliding avalanches are the main danger. Wet and gliding snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of gliding avalanches and wet snow slides being released will increase quickly in all aspects. In isolated cases, wet avalanches can reach intermediate altitudes in steep gullies.
On steep grassy slopes medium-sized to large gliding avalanches are possible. This applies on steep sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on steep shady slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night was reduced. The surface of the snowpack is not frozen and will already be soft in the early morning. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to extreme and thorough wetting of the snowpack. This applies on sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes also at intermediate and high altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Until Monday the weather will be exceptionally warm. The danger of wet and gliding avalanches will persist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wet and gliding avalanches are the main danger. Wet and gliding snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of gliding avalanches and wet snow slides being released will increase quickly in all aspects. In isolated cases, wet avalanches can reach intermediate altitudes in steep gullies.
On steep grassy slopes medium-sized to large gliding avalanches are possible. This applies on steep sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on steep shady slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night was reduced. The surface of the snowpack is not frozen and will already be soft in the early morning. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to extreme and thorough wetting of the snowpack. This applies on sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes also at intermediate and high altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Until Monday the weather will be exceptionally warm. The danger of wet and gliding avalanches will persist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be reduced. The avalanche danger will increase quickly in the early morning. Backcountry tours should be started and concluded very early. As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses. This applies in particular on very steep slopes above approximately 1900 m, as well as at the base of rock walls. Occasionally large natural avalanches are not ruled out. On wind-loaded slopes the avalanches can penetrate even deep layers. In the typical avalanche paths here the avalanches can in some cases reach low altitudes.

The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence at high altitude. These places are clearly recognisable to the trained eye. Backcountry tourers or freeriders can release avalanches. In particular on shady slopes the avalanches can penetrate even deep layers.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night was reduced. The surface of the snowpack is hardly frozen at all and will already be soft in the early morning. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to unfavourable bonding of the snowpack. This applies on sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes also at intermediate and high altitudes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses. In particular on very steep sunny slopes moist avalanches can slide on the ground.
Backcountry tours and off-piste skiing should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will soften earlier than the day before. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area below approximately 3000 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be very warm. The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already soften in the late morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses. In particular on very steep sunny slopes moist avalanches can slide on the ground.
Backcountry tours and off-piste skiing should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will soften earlier than the day before. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area below approximately 3000 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be very warm. The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already soften in the late morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
On steep grassy slopes medium-sized gliding avalanches are possible. As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of gliding avalanches and wet snow slides being released will increase quickly in all aspects, not only on sunny slopes, including on steep shady slopes at intermediate and high altitudes. In isolated cases, wet avalanches can reach intermediate altitudes in steep gullies.
Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be reduced in some case. The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already be soft in the early morning. This applies on sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes also at intermediate and high altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Until Monday the weather will be exceptionally warm. The danger of wet and gliding avalanches will persist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
On steep grassy slopes medium-sized gliding avalanches are possible. As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of gliding avalanches and wet snow slides being released will increase quickly in all aspects, not only on sunny slopes, including on steep shady slopes at intermediate and high altitudes. In isolated cases, wet avalanches can reach intermediate altitudes in steep gullies.
Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be reduced in some case. The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already be soft in the early morning. This applies on sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes also at intermediate and high altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Until Monday the weather will be exceptionally warm. The danger of wet and gliding avalanches will persist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Significant warming: The danger of wet avalanches will already increase in the late morning.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the natural activity of wet avalanches will rapidly increase. This applies in all aspects. The wet avalanches can release the saturated snowpack and reach medium size in isolated cases. On steep grassy slopes small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized gliding avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The weather will be exceptionally warm. The surface of the snowpack is hardly frozen at all and will already soften in the late morning. These conditions will cause a rapid weakening of the snowpack. Hardly any snow is lying at low and intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be exceptionally warm. The danger of wet and gliding avalanches will persist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The moist fresh snow of the last few days and the deep wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads, in particular on steep shady slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2500 m.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The high temperatures as the day progresses will give rise to rapid and thorough wetting of the old snowpack below approximately 2500 m. The fresh wind slabs are difficult even for the trained eye to recognise and to be assessed with care and prudence.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on shady slopes at intermediate and high altitudes. Small and medium-sized avalanches are possible in particular on steep shady slopes. Avalanches can be released by large loads.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise to thorough wetting of the snowpack over a wide area. The snowpack will become gradually wet all the way through. On sunny slopes hardly any snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment:
Over a wide area further warming.
As a consequence of warming the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The high temperatures as the day progresses will give rise to rapid and thorough wetting of the old snowpack in shady places that are protected from the wind below approximately 1700 m.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The avalanche prone locations are very rare and are easy to recognise.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The old snowpack will be generally wet all the way through.
